H0.text: Protons are the particles that atoms of different elements possess in varying numbers.

H1.text: Electrons are the numbers that atoms of different elements have different numbers of.

H2.text: Neutrons are the particles that atoms of different elements have different numbers of.

H3.text: The nucleus is what atoms of different elements have different numbers of.

A4.text: One or more protons are present in the nucleus of every atom.

A5.text: In chemistry, the number of protons in the nucleus of an atom is known as the atomic number, which determines the chemical element to which the atom belongs.
